author: Chef Oliver
title: The Best Oils for High-Heat Cooking
content: When cooking at high temperatures, it's important to use oils with a high smoke point. Avocado oil, refined olive oil, and peanut oil are great choices for frying and sautéing.

author: Nutritionist Maria
title: Why You Shouldn't Overheat Olive Oil
content: Extra virgin olive oil is great for salads and low-heat cooking, but overheating it can break down its healthy fats. For frying, choose refined olive oil instead.

author: Food Blogger Sam
title: The Healthiest Cooking Oils and Their Uses
content: Coconut oil is good for baking, sesame oil enhances Asian dishes, and ghee is an excellent butter substitute for frying due to its high smoke point.

author: Chef Lisa
title: Smoke Points: Why They Matter
content: The smoke point of an oil determines when it starts to break down and release harmful compounds. Always match the right oil to your cooking method!

author: Health Coach Alex
title: Choosing the Right Oil for Your Diet
content: For heart health, opt for oils rich in unsaturated fats like olive or flaxseed oil. For keto, coconut and avocado oil are excellent high-fat choices.

title: Test Consumer
author: Consument 2918
content: Hello, I really enjoy olive oil. I almost forgot to mention my favorite cooking oil ever is made of peanuts. I once heard you can heat it without any worries unlike other oils. What do you think about that?
